subject: Tennis
Basketball
lead_paragraph: The basketball Hall of Famer Julius Erving watched his daughter Alexandra Stevenson play tennis for the first time in a first-round loss at the Family Circle Cup in Charleston, S.C. Erving watched from the porch of the players’ clubhouse as Stevenson lost on clay to Akgul Amanmuradova of Uzbekistan, 6-2, 6-4. It has been a decade since Stevenson, 28, learned that Erving was her father, about the time she made the Wimbledon semifinals.
